content.p: The 2019 amendment, effective July 1, 2019, rewrote this Code section, which read: "Whoever, without malice, shall cause bodily harm to another by depriving him of a member of his body, by rendering a member of his body useless, by seriously disfiguring his body or a member thereof, or by causing organic brain damage which renders the body or any member thereof useless through the violation of Code Section 40-6-390 or 40-6-391 shall be guilty of the crime of serious injury by vehicle. A person convicted under this Code section shall be guilty of a felony and shall be punished by imprisonment for not less than one year nor more than 15 years."

The 2021 amendment, effective May 3, 2021, substituted "Code Sections 40-6-390 through 40-6-391" for "Code Section 40-6-390 or 40-6-391" in the first sentence of subsection (b). See Editor's notes for applicability.
